\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.extended_kalman_filter.ExtendedKalmanFilter.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Extended Kalman Filter for ODE and DAE systems implementation based on (1)

(1) Mandela, R. K., Narasimhan, S., \& Rengaswamy, R. (2009).
Nonlinear State Estimation of Differential Algebraic Systems. Proceedings of the 2009 ADCHEM (Vol. 42). IFAC.
\sphinxurl{http://doi.org/10.3182/20090712-4-TR-2008.00129}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SystemModel}}}}}) \textendash{} filter model

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t\_s}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} sampling time

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} current estimator time

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_mean}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} current state estimation

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p\_k}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} current covariance estimation

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_v}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} process noise covariance matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_n}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} measurement noise covariance matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_guess}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} initial guess of the algebraic variables for the model simulation

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.estimator_abstract.EstimatorAbstract}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.estimation.estimator\_abstract.EstimatorAbstract}}}}}
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.estimation.pce\_kalman\_filter.PCEKalmanFilter method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.pce_kalman_filter.PCEKalmanFilter.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SystemModel}}}}}) \textendash{} estimator model

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_mean}} \textendash{} a initial guess for the mean

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p\_k}} \textendash{} a initial guess for the covariance of the estimator

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h\_function}} \textendash{} a function that receives 3 parameters (x, y\_algebraic, u) and returns an measurement.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{c\_matrix}} \textendash{} if h\_function is not give, c\_matrix is “C” from the measurement equation:
y\_meas = C*{[}x y\_alg{]} + D*u. note that it has to have n\_x + n\_y (algebraic) columns.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_v}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} process noise matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_n}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} measurement noise matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pc\_order}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Polynomial chaos order

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_samples}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of samples to be used

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection{yaocptool.estimation.unscented\_kalman\_filter module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:module-yaocptool.estimation.unscented_kalman_filter}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool-estimation-unscented-kalman-filter-module}}\index{yaocptool.estimation.unscented\_kalman\_filter (module)}\index{UnscentedKalmanFilter (class in yaocptool.estimation.unscented\_kalman\_filter)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.unscented_kalman_filter.UnscentedKalmanFilter}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.estimation.unscented\_kalman\_filter.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{UnscentedKalmanFilter}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.estimator_abstract.EstimatorAbstract}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.estimation.estimator\_abstract.EstimatorAbstract}}}}}
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.estimation.unscented\_kalman\_filter.UnscentedKalmanFilter method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.unscented_kalman_filter.UnscentedKalmanFilter.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\begin{quote}

Unscented Kalman Filter. Two versions are implemented standard and square-root.
Implemented based on {[}1{]} and {[}2{]}.
\end{quote}

References:

{[}1{]} Wan, E. A., \& Van Der Merwe, R. (2000). The unscented Kalman filter for nonlinear estimation.
In Proceedings of the IEEE 2000 Adaptive Systems for Signal Processing, Communications, and Control Symposium
(Cat. No.00EX373) (Vol. v, pp. 153\textendash{}158). IEEE. \sphinxurl{http://doi.org/10.1109/ASSPCC.2000.882463}

{[}2{]} Merwe, R. Van Der, \& Wan, E. a. (2001). The square-root unscented Kalman filter for state and
parameter-estimation. 2001 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing.
Proceedings (Cat. No.01CH37221), 6, 1\textendash{}4. \sphinxurl{http://doi.org/10.1109/ICASSP.2001.940586}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SystemModel}}}}}) \textendash{} estimator model

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_mean}} \textendash{} a initial guess for the mean

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p\_k}} \textendash{} a initial guess for the covariance of the estimator

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h\_function}} \textendash{} a function that receives 3 parameters (x, y\_algebraic, u) and returns an measurement.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{c\_matrix}} \textendash{} if h\_function is not give, c\_matrix is “C” from the measurement equation:
y\_meas = C*{[}x y\_alg{]} + D*u. note that it has to have n\_x + n\_y (algebraic) columns.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_v}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} process noise matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{r\_n}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} measurement noise matrix

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{implementation}} \textendash{} options: ‘standard’ or ‘square-root’. (default: ‘standard’)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_initial\_guess() (yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase.create_initial_guess}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess}}}{\emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using problem.x\_0, problem.y\_guess, problem.u\_guess,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If y\_guess or u\_guess are None the initial guess uses a vector of zeros of appropriate size.
If no p or theta is given, an vector of zeros o appropriate size is used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation() (yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase.create_initial_guess_with_simulation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation}}}{\emph{u=None}, \emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using by simulating with a given control u,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If no u is given the value of problem.u\_guess is used, or problem.u\_past, then a vector of zeros of appropriate
size is used.
If no p or theta is given, an vector of zeros o appropriate size is used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{u}} \textendash{} Control initial guess

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{plot() (yaocptool.methods.base.optimizationresult.OptimizationResult method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.optimizationresult.OptimizationResult.plot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot}}}{\emph{plot\_list}, \emph{figures=None}, \emph{show=True}}{}
Plot the optimization result.
It takes as input a list of dictionaries, each dictionary represents a plot.  In the dictionary use keyword ‘x’
to specify which states you want to print, the value of the dictionary should be a list of state to be printed.
The keywords that are accepted are: ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘u’
:param list plot\_list: List of dictionaries to generate the plots.
:param list figures: OPTIONAL: list of figures to be plotted in. If not provided it will create new figures.
:param bool show: OPTIONAL: select if matplotlib.pyplot.show should be applied after the plots.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_control\_approximation() (yaocptool.methods.base.solutionmethodsbase.SolutionMethodsBase method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.solutionmethodsbase.SolutionMethodsBase.create_control_approximation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_control\_approximation}}}{}{}
Parametrize the control variable, accordingly to the ‘degree\_control’ attribute.
If degree\_control == 1, then a piecewise constant control will be used (most common).
If degree\_control \textgreater{} 1, then a piecewise polynomial approximation will be used with order ‘degree\_control’.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

@author: marco
\index{CollocationScheme (class in yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CollocationScheme}}}{\emph{solution\_method}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase}}}}}
\index{create\_initial\_guess() (yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme.create_initial_guess}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess}}}{\emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using problem.x\_0, problem.y\_guess, problem.u\_guess,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If y\_guess or u\_guess are None the initial guess uses a vector of zeros of appropriate size.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation() (yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme.create_initial_guess_with_simulation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation}}}{\emph{u=None}, \emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using by simulating with a given control u,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If no u is given the value of problem.u\_guess is used, or problem.last\_u, then a vector of zeros of appropriate
size is used.
If no p or theta is given, an vector of zeros of appropriate size is used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{u}} \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_nlp\_symbolic\_variables() (yaocptool.methods.classic.collocationscheme.CollocationScheme method)}

@author: marco

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.MultipleShootingScheme}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MultipleShootingScheme}}}{\emph{solution\_method}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.base.discretizationschemebase.DiscretizationSchemeBase}}}}}
\index{create\_initial\_guess() (yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.MultipleShootingScheme method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.MultipleShootingScheme.create_initial_guess}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess}}}{\emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using problem.x\_0, problem.y\_guess, problem.u\_guess,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If y\_guess or u\_guess are None the initial guess uses a vector of zeros of appropriate size.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation() (yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.MultipleShootingScheme method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.classic:yaocptool.methods.classic.multipleshooting.MultipleShootingScheme.create_initial_guess_with_simulation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_initial\_guess\_with\_simulation}}}{\emph{u=None}, \emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}}{}
Create an initial guess for the optimal control problem using by simulating with a given control u,
and a given p and theta (for p\_opt and theta\_opt) if they are given.
If no u is given the value of problem.u\_guess is used, or problem.last\_u, then a vector of zeros of appropriate
size is used.
If no p or theta is given, an vector of zeros o appropriate size is used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{u}} \textendash{} Control initial guess

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} \textendash{} Optimization parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} \textendash{} Optimization theta

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.methods:yaocptool.methods.augmented_lagrangian.AugmentedLagrangian}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.augmented\_lagrangian.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{AugmentedLagrangian}}}{\emph{problem}, \emph{ocp\_solver\_class}, \emph{solver\_options=None}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.solutionmethodsbase.SolutionMethodsBase}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.methods.base.solutionmethodsbase.SolutionMethodsBase}}}}}
\begin{description}
\item[{For a minimization problem in the form}] \leavevmode
min f(x,u) = int L(x,u) dt
s.t.: dot\{x\} = f(x,u),
g\_ineq (x,u) leq 0

\item[{Transforms the problem in a sequence of solution of the problem}] \leavevmode
min f(x,u) = int L(x,u) -mu sum log(-g\_ineq(x,u)) dt
s.t.: dot\{x\} = f(x,u),

\end{description}
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.methods.augmented\_lagrangian.AugmentedLagrangian method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

every iteration.

\subsubsection{yaocptool.modelling.dataset module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:module-yaocptool.modelling.dataset}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool-modelling-dataset-module}}\index{yaocptool.modelling.dataset (module)}\index{DataSet (class in yaocptool.modelling.dataset)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.modelling.dataset.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{DataSet}}}{\emph{name='dataset'}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{name='dataset'}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\begin{quote}

Generic time dependent data storage.
The data is stored in the self.data dictionary.
self.data{[}‘entry\_name’{]}{[}‘time’{]} is a row vector
self.data{[}‘entry\_name’{]}{[}‘values’{]} is a matrix with the same number of columns as the time vector, and
rows equal to self.data{[}‘entry\_name’{]}{[}‘size’{]}.
The data can be more easily managed using create\_entry, get\_entry, insert\_data.
\end{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} name of th dataset

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plot\_style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} default plot style. plot = linear interpolation, step = piecewise constant (‘plot’ \textbar{} ‘step’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{find\_discontinuity}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Default: True. If True, it will try to find discontinuity on the data, and plot
with gaps where data is missing/not available, instead of a line connecting all data points.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{max\_sampling\_time}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} maximum expected distance between two time data. This is used to detect
discontinuity on the data, and plot it separately.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_entry() (yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet.create_entry}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_entry}}}{\emph{entry}, \emph{size}, \emph{names=None}, \emph{plot\_style=None}}{}~\begin{quote}

Create an entry in the dataset
\end{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{entry}} \textendash{} entry name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{size}} \textendash{} number of rows in the vector

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{names}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} name for each row, it should be a list with size ‘size’. If ‘names’ is not given, then the
name list {[}entry\_1, entry\_2, …, entry\_size{]}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plot\_style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} (‘plot’ \textbar{} ‘step’) choose if the plot will be piecewise constant (step) or a first order
interpolation (plot).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{plot() (yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet.plot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot}}}{\emph{plot\_list}, \emph{figures=None}, \emph{show=True}}{}
Plot DataSet information.
It takes as input a list of dictionaries, each dictionary represents a plot.  In the dictionary use keyword ‘x’
to specify which states you want to print, the value of the dictionary should be a list of index of the states
to be printed.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plot\_list}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List of dictionaries to generate the plots.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{figures}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} list of figures to be plotted on top (optional)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{show}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} if the plotted figures should be shown after plotting (optional, default=True).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{sort() (yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.dataset.DataSet.sort}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sort}}}{\emph{entries=None}}{}~\begin{quote}

Sort the dataset for given ‘entries’ in an chronological order, this can be used when data is not inserted
in an ordered fashion.
\end{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode

\item[{Example of connections\_dict:}] \leavevmode
Connections 0:
z\_sym{[}0{]} in Node 0 is connected to z\_sym{[}2{]} in Node 1

\item[{it can also be a multidimensional connection:}] \leavevmode
Connection 1:
z\_sym{[}0:1{]} in Node 1 is connected to z\_sym{[}1:2{]} in Node 4
connections\_dict = \{1: {[}\{1:{[}0,1{]}\}, \{4:{[}1,2{]}\}{]}\}

\end{description}

\subsubsection{yaocptool.modelling.ocp module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:module-yaocptool.modelling.ocp}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool-modelling-ocp-module}}\index{yaocptool.modelling.ocp (module)}
Created on Mon Apr 03 11:15:03 2017

@author: marco
\index{OptimalControlProblem (class in yaocptool.modelling.ocp)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.modelling.ocp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{OptimalControlProblem}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Optimal Control Problem class, used to define a optimal control problem based on a model (SystemModel)
It has the following form:
\begin{align*}\!\begin{aligned}
\min J &= V(x(t_f), p) + \int_{t_0} ^{t_f} L(x,y,u,t,p,\theta) \, dt
 + \sum_{k} S(x(t_k), y(t_k), u(t_k), t_k, p, \theta_k)\\
\textrm{s.t.:}\,& \dot{x} = f(x,y,u,t,p,\theta)\\
& g(x,y,u,t,p,\theta) = 0\\
& g_{eq} (x,y,u,t,p,\theta) = 0\\
& g_{ineq}(x,y,u,t,p,\theta) \leq 0\\
& x_{min} \leq x \leq x_{max}\\
& y_{min} \leq y \leq y_{max}\\
& u_{min} \leq u \leq u_{max}\\
& \Delta u_{min} \leq \Delta u \leq \Delta u_{max}\\
& h_{initial} (x (t_0), t_0, p, \theta) = 0\\
& h_{final} (x (t_f), t_f, p, \theta) = 0\\
& h (p) = 0\\
\end{aligned}\end{align*}
where  \(t_k\) is final time in each finite element.
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem method)}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_cost\_state() (yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem.create_cost_state}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_cost\_state}}}{}{}
Transforms the integral int\_\{t\_0\}\textasciicircum{}\{t\_f\} L(…) dt into a dynamic cost state:
dot\{x\}\_c = L(…)
and include x\_c(t\_f) into the final time cost (V(t\_f) += x\_c(t\_f)).

object

\index{include\_time\_equality() (yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem.include_time_equality}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{include\_time\_equality}}}{\emph{eq}, \emph{when='default'}}{}
Include time dependent equality.
g\_eq(…, t) = 0, for t in {[}t\_0, t\_f{]}

The inequality is concatenated to “g\_ineq”
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eq}} \textendash{} equality

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{when}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Can be ‘default’, ‘end’, ‘start’.
‘start’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the start of every finite element
‘end’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the end of every finite element
‘default’ - will be evaluated at each collocation point of every finite element.
For the multiple shooting, the constraint will be evaluated at the end of each
finite element

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{include\_time\_inequality() (yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.ocp.OptimalControlProblem.include_time_inequality}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{include\_time\_inequality}}}{\emph{eq}, \emph{when='default'}}{}
Include time dependent inequality.
g\_ineq(…, t) \textless{}= 0, for t in {[}t\_0, t\_f{]}

The inequality is concatenated to “g\_ineq”
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{when}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Can be ‘default’, ‘end’, ‘start’.
‘start’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the start of every finite element
‘end’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the end of every finite element
‘default’ - will be evaluated at each collocation point of every finite element.
For the multiple shooting, the constraint will be evaluated at the end of each
finite element

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eq}} \textendash{} inequality

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{include\_time\_chance\_inequality() (yaocptool.modelling.stochastic\_ocp.StochasticOCP method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.stochastic_ocp.StochasticOCP.include_time_chance_inequality}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{include\_time\_chance\_inequality}}}{\emph{ineq}, \emph{prob}, \emph{rhs=None}, \emph{when='default'}}{}
Include time dependent chance inequality.
Prob{[}ineq(…, t) \textless{}= rhs{]} \textless{}= prob, for t in {[}t\_0, t\_f{]}

The inequality is concatenated to “g\_stochastic\_ineq”
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ineq}} \textendash{} inequality

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rhs}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list\textbar{}DM}}) \textendash{} Right-hand size of the inequality

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prob}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list\textbar{}DM}}) \textendash{} Chance/probability of the constraint being satisfied

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{when}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Can be ‘default’, ‘end’, ‘start’.
‘start’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the start of every finite element
‘end’ - the constraint will be evaluated at the end of every finite element
‘default’ - will be evaluated at each collocation point of every finite element.
For the multiple shooting, the constraint will be evaluated at the end of each
finite element

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{include\_uncertain\_parameter() (yaocptool.modelling.stochastic\_ocp.StochasticOCP method)}

\subsubsection{yaocptool.modelling.system\_model module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:module-yaocptool.modelling.system_model}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool-modelling-system-model-module}}\index{yaocptool.modelling.system\_model (module)}
Created on Thu Jun 09 10:50:48 2016

@author: marco
\index{SystemModel (class in yaocptool.modelling.system\_model)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{SystemModel}}}{\emph{name='model'}, \emph{n\_x=0}, \emph{n\_y=0}, \emph{n\_u=0}, \emph{n\_p=0}, \emph{n\_theta=0}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{name='model'}, \emph{n\_x=0}, \emph{n\_y=0}, \emph{n\_u=0}, \emph{n\_p=0}, \emph{n\_theta=0}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\begin{quote}

Continuous-time Dynamic System Model
\end{quote}
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\dot{x} = f(x,y,u,t,p,\theta) \\
g(x,y,u,t,p,\theta) = 0\\\end{split}
\end{equation*}
x - states
y - algebraic
u - control
p - constant parameters
theta - parameters dependent of the finite\_elements (e.g.: disturbances)

Note: when vectorizing the parameters order is {[} p; theta; u\_par{]}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} \textendash{} model name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_x}} \textendash{} number of states (will automatically create states with name ‘x’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_y}} \textendash{} number of algebraics (will automatically create algebraic with name ‘y’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_u}} \textendash{} number of controls (will automatically create control with name ‘u’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_p}} \textendash{} number of parameters (will automatically create parameters with name ‘p’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_theta}} \textendash{} number of theta parameters (will automatically create theta parameters with name ‘theta’)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_name\_as\_prefix}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} if true all variables create will have the model name as prefix
e.g.: ‘tank\_h’, where ‘tank’ is model name and ‘h’ is the state created

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{all\_sym (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel.all_sym}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{all\_sym}}}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{connect() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel.connect}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{connect}}}{\emph{u}, \emph{y}}{}
Connect an input ‘u’ to a algebraic variable ‘y’, u = y.
The function will perform the following actions:
- include an algebraic equation u - y = 0
- remove ‘u’ from the input vector (since it is not a free variable anymore)
- include ‘u’ into the algebraic vector, since it is an algebraic variable now.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{u}} \textendash{} input variable

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} \textendash{} algebraic variable

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_algebraic\_variable() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Create a new algebraic variable with the name “name” and size “size”.
Size can be an int or a tuple (e.g. (2,2)). However, the new algebraic variable will be vectorized (casadi.vec)
to be included in the algebraic vector (model.y\_sym).

\index{create\_state() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{find\_equilibrium() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel.find_equilibrium}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{find\_equilibrium}}}{\emph{additional\_eqs}, \emph{guess=None}, \emph{t\_0=0.0}, \emph{rootfinder\_options=None}}{}
Find a equilibrium point for the model.
This method solves the root finding problem:
\begin{quote}

f(x,y,u,t\_0) = 0
g(x,y,u,t\_0) = 0
additional\_eqs (x,y,u,t\_0) = 0
\end{quote}

Use additional\_eqs to specify the additional conditions remembering that dim(additional\_eqs) = n\_u,
so the system can be well defined.
If no initial guess is provided (“guess” parameter) a guess of ones will be used (not zero to avoid problems
with singularities.

Returns x\_0, y\_0, u\_0
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rootfinder\_options}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} options to be passed to rootfinder

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{additional\_eqs}} \textendash{} SX

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{guess}} \textendash{} DM

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t\_0}} \textendash{} float

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
(DM, DM, DM)

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{simulate() (yaocptool.modelling.system\_model.SystemModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.system_model.SystemModel.simulate}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{simulate}}}{\emph{x\_0}, \emph{t\_f}, \emph{t\_0=0.0}, \emph{u=None}, \emph{p=None}, \emph{theta=None}, \emph{y\_0=None}, \emph{integrator\_type='implicit'}, \emph{integrator\_options=None}}{}~\begin{description}
\item[{Simulate model.}] \leavevmode
If t\_f is a float, then only one simulation will be done. If t\_f is a list of times, then a sequence of
simulations will be done, that each t\_f is the end of a finite element.

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list\textbar{}\textbar{}DM}}) \textendash{} Initial condition

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t\_f}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float\textbar{}\textbar{}list}}) \textendash{} Final time of the simulation, can be a list of final times for sequential simulation

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t\_0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Initial time

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{u}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list\textbar{}\textbar{}DM}}) \textendash{} Controls of the system to be simulated

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM\textbar{}\textbar{}SX\textbar{}\textbar{}list}}) \textendash{} Simulation parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theta}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} Parameters theta, which varies for each simulation for sequential simulations.
If t\_f is a list then theta has to have one entry for each k in {[}0,…,len(t\_f){]}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_0}} \textendash{} Initial guess for the algebraic variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{integrator\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} ‘implicit’ or ‘explicit’

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{integrator\_options}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} options to be passed to the integrator

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.modelling:yaocptool.modelling.simualtion_result.SimulationResult}]{\sphinxcrossref{SimulationResult}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{yaocptool.mpc package}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:yaocptool-mpc-package}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc::doc}}

\subsubsection{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:submodules}}

\subsubsection{yaocptool.mpc.mpc module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:module-yaocptool.mpc.mpc}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:yaocptool-mpc-mpc-module}}\index{yaocptool.mpc.mpc (module)}\index{MPC (class in yaocptool.mpc.mpc)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:yaocptool.mpc.mpc.MPC}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.mpc.mpc.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MPC}}}{\emph{plant}, \emph{solution\_method}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}~\index{\_\_init\_\_() (yaocptool.mpc.mpc.MPC method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.mpc:yaocptool.mpc.mpc.MPC.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{plant}, \emph{solution\_method}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Model Predictive control class. Requires a plant and a solution\_method.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plant}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Plant\textbar{}PlantSimulation}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{solution\_method}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.methods.base:yaocptool.methods.base.solutionmethodsbase.SolutionMethodsBase}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SolutionMethodsBase}}}}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{estimator}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{yaocptool.estimation:yaocptool.estimation.estimator_abstract.EstimatorAbstract}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{EstimatorAbstract}}}}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{default\_p}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} is a default parameter vector that will be used by the ‘solution\_method’

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{default\_theta}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DM}}) \textendash{} is a default theta parameter that will be used by the ‘solution\_method’

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{include\_cost\_in\_state\_vector}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Typically the optimal control problem has one extra state than the
plant, the dynamic cost state. By setting this variable to True, it automatically include an zero the in state
vector obtained from the estimator.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mean\_as\_parameter}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} The mean estimated by the Estimator as parameter of the OCP. It will be put in
the end of parameter vector, before the covariance if covariance\_as\_parameter=True.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{covariance\_as\_parameter}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} The covariance estimated by the Estimator as parameter of the OCP. It will
be put in the end of parameter vector.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mean\_p\_indices}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} If mean\_as\_parameter=True, mean\_p\_indices is a list of tuples (pairs), where the
first element of the tuple is the index in the mean vector and the second is the index in the p vector.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_p\_indices}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} If covariance\_as\_parameter=True, cov\_p\_indices is a list of tuples (pairs), where the
first element of the tuple is the index in the vectorized covariance matrix and the second is the index in the p
vector.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{state\_rearrangement\_function}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{function}}) \textendash{} A function that can be used to rearrange the initial condition in
cases where the estimated states is not equal to initial condition vector of the OCP. For instance, when the OCP
has multiple representations of the system. The provided function has the estimated stated as input and has to
return a initial condition vector.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Abstract Optimization Problem class
Optimization problem
\end{quote}
\begin{align*}\!\begin{aligned}
\min_x f(x, p)\\
\textrm{s.t.:} g_{lb} \leq g(x,p) \leq g_{ub}\\
Object attributes:
x -> optimization variables
g -> constraint\\
\end{aligned}\end{align*}\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_x}} \textendash{} int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_variable() (yaocptool.optimization.abstract\_optimization\_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.optimization:yaocptool.optimization.abstract_optimization_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem.create_variable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_variable}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{size=1}, \emph{lb=-inf}, \emph{ub=inf}}{}
Create an optimization variable
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Name of the optimization variable.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{size}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Size of the variable (default = 1)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lb}} \textendash{} Lower bound of the variable. If the given ‘size’ is greater than one but a scalar is passed as lower
bound, a vector of lb of size ‘size’ will be used as a lower bound. (default = {[}-inf{]}*size)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ub}} \textendash{} Upper bound of the variable. If the given ‘size’ is greater than one but a scalar is passed as upper
bound, a vector of ub of size ‘size’ will be used as a upper bound. (default = {[}inf{]}*size)

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Return the variable

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
MX

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{include\_equality() (yaocptool.optimization.abstract\_optimization\_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.optimization:yaocptool.optimization.abstract_optimization_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem.include_equality}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{include\_equality}}}{\emph{expr}, \emph{rhs=None}}{}
Include a equality with the following form
expr = rhs
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{expr}} \textendash{} expression, this is the only term that should contain symbolic variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rhs}} \textendash{} right hand side, by default it is a vector of zeros with same size of expr. If the  ‘expr’ size is
greater than one but a scalar is passed as ‘rhs’, a vector of ‘rhs’ with size of ‘expr’ will be used as
right hand side. (default = {[}0{]}*size)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{include\_inequality() (yaocptool.optimization.abstract\_optimization\_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.optimization:yaocptool.optimization.abstract_optimization_problem.AbstractOptimizationProblem.include_inequality}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{include\_inequality}}}{\emph{expr}, \emph{lb=None}, \emph{ub=None}}{}
Include inequality to the problem with the following form
lb \textless{}= expr \textless{}= ub
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{expr}} \textendash{} expression for the inequality, this is the only term that should contain symbolic variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lb}} \textendash{} Lower bound of the inequality. If the ‘expr’ size is greater than one but a scalar is passed as
lower bound, a vector of lb with size of ‘expr’ will be used as a lower bound. (default = {[}-inf{]}*size)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ub}} \textendash{} Upper bound of the inequality. If the  ‘expr’ size is greater than one but a scalar is passed as
upper bound, a vector of ub with size of  ‘expr’ will be used as a upper bound. (default = {[}inf{]}*size)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item {}

(default = {[}inf{]}*size)

\end{itemize}

Quadratic Optimization Problem class
Optimization problem
\end{quote}
\begin{align*}\!\begin{aligned}
\min_x &f(x, p)\\
\textrm{s.t.:} &g_{lb} \leq g(x,p) \leq g_{ub}\\
\end{aligned}\end{align*}
Object attributes:
x -\textgreater{} optimization variables
g -\textgreater{} constraint

\subsubsection{yaocptool.parallel.worker module}
\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.parallel:module-yaocptool.parallel.worker}}\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.parallel:yaocptool-parallel-worker-module}}\index{yaocptool.parallel.worker (module)}\index{Worker (class in yaocptool.parallel.worker)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{yaocptool.parallel:yaocptool.parallel.worker.Worker}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yaocptool.parallel.worker.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Worker}}}{\emph{obj\_class}, \emph{obj\_arg}, \emph{function\_name}, \emph{queue\_in}, \emph{queue\_out}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{multiprocessing.process.Process}}

Creates new process that creates and object of class ‘obj\_class’ with ‘obj\_arg’ argument.
It will consume one element from each queue\_in and call function ‘function\_name’ the consumed elements as argument.
It will put the return of the ‘function\_name’ call in all Queues in queue\_out

Since casadi does not have native support for matrix exponential, this is a trick to computing it.
It can be quite expensive, specially for large matrices.
THIS ONLY SUPPORT NUMERIC MATRICES AND MX VARIABLES, DOES NOT SUPPORT SX SYMBOLIC VARIABLES.
